Description: Sets the server name visible in the game browser
Sets the server name visible in the game browser
Sets the maximum number of players that may connect to the server at one time
IP address where the server's sockets should be bound. Leave empty for 'all interfaces'.
Logging level of the server. Messages of this severity and more important will be logged. Can be any of debug/info/warning/error
Authenticate users with Steam to check VAC ban when set to true.
Sets the track for the server, Grid Size (size)
Vehicles (class)

Description: Vehicles Classes
Number of gameplay events stored on the server. Oldest ones will be discarded once the game logs more.
Delay between server ticks in milliseconds when not hosting.
Delay between server ticks in milliseconds when hosting a game.
Set to true to make this server show up in the browser even if it's empty.
Set to true to enable API that allows the server to control the game's setup (host won't control setup).
Control the Host ability to change track via the garage.
Control the Host ability to change vehicle class via the garage.
Control the Host ability to change vehicle
Grid size up to 32, reserved to players (AI when GridSize > MaxPlayers).
Maximum players for session (same as session attribute MaxPlayers).

Race flags - bitfield consisting of many flags. To build a session flags value add the numeric values of desired flags (example default shown). See /api/list/flags/session or the SessionFlags reference object for names and values. Put the resulting integer into this text field.

Reference mapping of SessionFlags names to their numeric values. Use this block to inspect the numeric value for each flag — the UI will return the numeric key. To build a session Flags value, add the numeric values of the desired flags and paste the sum into the 'Session Flags (bitfield)' field.
Reference mapping of PlayerFlags names to their numeric values. Use this block to inspect numeric values for player status flags — the UI will return the numeric key.
Starting date year.
Starting date month.
Starting date day.
Starting date hour.
Starting date minute.
Standard speed for date progression.
Standard speed for weather progression.
Practice 1 length (minutes).
Practice 2 length (minutes).
Qualify length (minutes).
Warmup length (minutes).
Race 1 length (laps).
AI opponent difficulty, 0-100.
Damage type setting (visual/realistic).
Tire wear setting. Choose an aggressiveness preset (X7..X2), STANDARD, SLOW or OFF.
Fuel usage setting. STANDARD (0), SLOW (1) or OFF (2).
Penalty enforcement type. NONE = 0, FULL = 1.
Camera views allowed. Note: the game supports only 'Any' (0) and 'CockpitHelmet' (2) in practice.
Number of weather slots set.
Weather slot 1 value.
Weather slot 2 value.
Weather slot 3 value.
Weather slot 4 value.
When set the server can restrict which parts of the game setup the host may change
Length of the second race in laps (if a multi-race event is configured).
Session privacy/visibility setting. Use 0 for public sessions; other values may restrict visibility depending on client support.
Master enable/disable toggle for the HTTP API.
IP/interface to bind the HTTP API to (empty = all interfaces).
Port for the HTTP API.
Similar to logLevel above but used only for libwebsockets output. All logging still goes through the main filter.
Map with extra HTTP headers to add to HTTP API responses. Keys are conditions, values are headers; use '*' for a wildcard.
Overrides for HTTP API endpoint access levels. The keys are wildcard endpoint paths and the values are access levels.
Filtering rules for HTTP API access levels. Map from level names to lists of rules.
User list for HTTP API (map from username to password)."stepan" : "foo",
User groups for HTTP API (map from group name to list of users)."private" : [ "stepan", "michal" ],"admin" : [ "stepan" ],
Master enable/disable toggle for the Lua API.
Root directory from which the Lua addons are loaded.
Directory where addon configs will be stored.
Root directory where addon output will be written.
Names of all Lua addons to load (ordered list).
